modmenu.descriptionTranslation.realcamer: Make the camera more realistic in the first-person view.
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.binding: Camera's offset from modelPart being bound
Note: camera's front, up and left are the X, Y and Z axes respectively
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.classic: Camera's offset from its rotation center
Note: player's front, up and left are the X, Y and Z axes respectively
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.compatS: These options will only appear if the corresponding mod is installed
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.cameraR: Note: Pitch, yaw and roll are rotations on the left, up and front axes respectively
config.option.xtracr_realcamera.compatsT: Please refer to the %s of this mod to see the list of supported mods and model part names
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.classic: Classic mode only makes simple changes to the position and rotation of camera
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.dynamic:
When enabled, the crosshair will follow the player's view, ensuring consistent hit result
Recommended to enable when Jade, WTHIT or similar mods are installed
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.renderM: Render player model in first-person perspective
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.adjustS: Length or 1/4 of the angle of the adjustment per step
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.scale: Control the size of the config values, 16 = 1 block
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.vanilla: Model part to bind camera to
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.adjustO: When pressing the adjustment key, adjust the offset or rotation of camera
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.offsetM: Move the model to camera to keep the camera position constant. Compatibility with other mods may become better when turned on
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.classic: Determine which to adjust when pressing the adjustment key
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.useModM:
Binding Mode config is automatically used if failed to find target model part
Status: %s 
(To refresh the status, you need to reload the config screen)
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.modMode: Name of the model part to bind camera to
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.disable: Possible options(There may be other options not listed here): %s
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.customC: Available options: [disable_mod, disable_rendering, allow_rendering_hand] and Model Part Names
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.autoBin: Automatically searches through saved lists based on the current player model texture
config.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.depth: Planes where all vertex-to-screen distances are less than this value will not be rendered
screen.tooltip.xtracr_realcamera.modelVi:
Hold left Alt and left click to get the UV coordinates at the mouse pointer
The three sets of UV coordinates below are, from top to bottom, the forward vector, the upward vector, and the UV coordinates of the plane's center
Note: Scroll with left Alt held to switch between the different layers of model. Manually inputting UV coordinates allows you to bind more accurately to the target position

The texture id of the selected model (not necessary to be the full id), can be shortened when saving to make it easier to recognize.
For example, shorten minecraft:textures/entity/player/slim/alex.png to minecraft:textures/entity/player/.
When disabled, the camera's relative relationship to the model will not change, but the camera's corresponding attributes will not be modified by this mod
Scale, which controls the size of the offsets
Planes where all vertex-to-screen distances are less than this value will not be rendered
Prioritized when binding, and displayed in green on the right side
